intro: Daviesia localis, commonly known as the Kangaroo Island Daviesia, is a flowering plant native to South Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, pink or pale red flowers during the spring season. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the dry climate of its native habitat. Daviesia localis is a shrub that grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters.
